text: the javadoc index page that lists all methods starts having red text at JDBC appender and all text thereafter in red. This is caused by the warning message in the javadoc comments being 2 sentences long and highlighted in red. For the index page, javadoc program takes only the first sentence and so misses the closing font tag at the end of the second sentence. I use version 1.2.15.

creator: thorbjoern@gmail.com
text:
The URL for this is

http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/apidocs/index-all.html#_J_

The problem is that JavaDoc uses the first sentence only, and the warning message is TWO sentences so the trailing </font> is not copied in.

By moving the actual description up above the warning message this should present an accurate overview in the index.
